panels.title: Backend - number of queued requests not assigned to any server
Frontend - HTTP requests OK / Error / Denied
Back - Total of redispatch / error / retry warnings
Frontend - current number of active sessions
Backend - current number of active sessions
Frontend - current number of sessions rate per second over last elapsed second
Backend - current number of sessions rate per second over last elapsed second
Frontend - maximum observed number of active sessions and limit
Backend - maximum observed number of active sessions and limit
Frontend - maximum number of sessions rate per second and limit
Backend - Maximum number of sessions rate per second

panels.description: The resulting metric is the ratio of the pool servers that see the backed as up to the total number of pool servers for the given pool.
panels.title: Backend - current health status of the backend

panels.description: The average weight of the given backend. A pool can have more than 1 pool server, hence the average is calculated across all the pool servers.
panels.title: Backend - total weight of the servers in the backend
Server - number of queued requests assigned to this server
Server - maximum observed number of queued requests assigned to this server
Server - total of HTTP responses OK
By Server Responses by HTTP code
Server - current number of active sessions

panels.description: The sever health is an average of the health metrics across the given pool, application path, and dc/os cluster.
panels.title: Server - server health
Number of errors while parsing CSV
